description: Construction of two storey end of terrace house
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers  1061-7, 1061-9 revision A unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.9 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment', policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan. | Details of the parking area and a minimum of 2 cycle spaces for the new dwelling shall be provided in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority. Detail of which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently for the lifetime of the development.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate parking within the site, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of landscape and boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development and shall be in place prior to the occupation of the buildings hereby approved/commencement of the use, and permanently maintained thereafter for the lifetime of the development.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, Plan for the Environment (2004) and policies and policies 7.4, of the London Plan (2011) and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy. | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the development is commenced, for the provision of a refuse/ recycling storage area, prior to the occupation of the development.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 4 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities', policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policy 7.4  of the London Plan. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D and E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no extensions or works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building. | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, which will achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10.  The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority's criteria.  The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the future occupiers of the approved development are adequately protected against rail traffic, road traffic and commercial noise, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2011) and to Supplementary Planning Guidance 10.
